content:
CHICAGO  It was a chaotic scene Hundreds of screaming people stumbling down the darkened stairs of a crowded nightclub gasping for air and stepping on bodies only to find themselves trapped at the bottom with one open exit PERIOD

At least  people were killed and  injured in the pandemonium early Monday at the E2 nightclub authorities said PERIOD There were reports that as many as  people were crammed into the secondfloor club when someone sprayed Mace or pepper spray to quell a fight at about  a.m PERIOD

Witnesses described a frenzied scene of some people trying to climb through the ceiling while others were trampled in the frantic rush for an exit their faces and bodies flattened against the glass front door PERIOD

Some people fainted on the club floor others were coughing and crying gagging and blindly groping for any way out PERIOD

 said Amishoov Blackwell a 30yearold patron PERIOD 

Blackwell said one man crushed between two people told him 

Some witnesses reported that the lights were cut in the stairwell PERIOD

Firefighters with sledgehammers and pry bars desperately struggled to open other doors in the halfblocklong building PERIOD Some were locked others blocked by laundry bags from the firstfloor Epitome restaurant authorities said PERIOD

 Fire Commissioner James Joyce said PERIOD 

The locked doors are a fire code violation Joyce said PERIOD He said at the most recent inspection in the fall of  there were no blocked or locked doors or other serious violations PERIOD

Fire officials say they do not know the legal capacity of the club but initially estimated the crowd at  PERIOD

Police Commissioner Terry Hillard said investigators were trying to sort out conflicting stories about the source of the Mace or pepper spray and obtain videotape from inside the club PERIOD Witnesses said the spray may have come from the clubs security guards trying to break up a fight between at least two women PERIOD

 Hillard said PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Friends and family of missing patrons flocked to the morgue Monday afternoon searching for information and holding out hope that their loved ones were still alive PERIOD

 said Herschel Blake who was looking for his 22yearold grandson Michael PERIOD 

Witnesses said some people were stomped on many victims suffered crushing chest and head injuries PERIOD

 said clubgoer Reggie Clark PERIOD 

Water and ice were passed to some of those trapped as rescuers struggled to pull them from the building PERIOD

 said Cory Thomas  who went to the club to pick up two friends PERIOD 

 Thomas said PERIOD 

The president of a Chicago entertainment agency that has booked acts at the club said access to the building was unsafe for the number of people reported to be there early Monday PERIOD

 said Ron Onesti of Onesti Entertainment Co PERIOD 

Photographs on Onestis Web site depict packed crowds at the nightclub PERIOD Onesti maintained that his agency had nothing to do with managing the club and hadnt had any dealings involving it in about a year PERIOD

The club is located in the Near South Side a commercial district near the McCormick Place convention center PERIOD

The stampede was one of the nations deadliest PERIOD

In December  nine young people were crushed to death in a gymnasium stairwell while awaiting a celebrity basketball game in New York PERIOD

In December   people were killed in Cincinnati in a crush to get into a concert by The Who PERIOD
